remarks: A sum of nonnegative numbers is greater than or equal to any one of its terms.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 4-Jun-2014.)
statement:
fsumge0.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
fsumge0.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> B e. RR ) $.
fsumge0.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> 0 <_ B ) $.
fsumge1.4 $e |- ( k = M -> B = C ) $.
fsumge1.5 $e |- ( ph -> M e. A ) $.
fsumge1 $p |- ( ph -> C <_ sum_ k e. A B ) $.
$d A k $.
$d C k $.
$d M k $.
$d k ph $.
